definition: to press close to/to snuggle close/intimate
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip

sentences.english: We make every endeavor to satisfy our customers.
sentences.chinese: 貼近客戶，持續的保持顧客滿意度。

sentences.english: 29The Spirit told Philip, "Go to that chariot and stay near it."
sentences.chinese: 聖靈對腓利說，你去貼近那車走。

sentences.english: “They showed in this paper that the birds were actually staying quite close to the mountain, ” she says.
sentences.chinese: 它們在這份研究中顯示，那些鳥實際上相當貼近山飛。

sentences.english: Using language vividly helps bring your speech to life.
sentences.chinese: 準確生動地使用語言能夠使你的演說貼近生活。

sentences.english: The second image is close to what is called a underpainting.
sentences.chinese: 第二個圖像是貼近被稱爲打底。

sentences.english: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的人沒有一個敢貼近他們，百姓卻尊重他們。

sentences.english: Elbows are set close to the body and turn neither in nor out.
sentences.chinese: 肘部貼近身軀，既不向內彎，也不向外翻。

sentences.english: I awoke and saw that I was holding too hard against my chest, the shell of a turtle.
sentences.chinese: 我醒來，看到我貼近胸膛緊緊握着龜殼。

sentences.english: Suitable design for waist, greater comfort and enhanced prevention of back leaks.
sentences.chinese: 貼近腰身設計，穿着更舒適，防背漏效果更加。

sentences.english: Wu Peixin put all the clues in series, with the facts very close.
sentences.chinese: 吳佩欣把所有的線索都串聯了起來，跟事實很貼近了。

sentences.english: Working closely with the client understanding business continuity to ensure satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 貼近客戶，持續的保持顧客滿意度。

sentences.english: A bush is smaller, lower, and has branches closer to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 灌木較小，較矮，而且枝條比較貼近地面。

sentences.english: Fill in the background of a watercolor bowl painting by darkening the paint and getting close to the edge of the bowl.
sentences.chinese: 填寫一個碗畫的水彩顏料變暗和貼近的碗邊緣的背景。

sentences.english: He no longer tried to make his pictures true-to-life.
sentences.chinese: 他不再嘗試將他的畫作貼近生活。

sentences.english: Furthermore, waterlily blooms float on water surface and bear no woody pod but round berries.
sentences.chinese: 睡蓮花貼近或浮於水面，不具蓮蓬而結漿果。

sentences.english: There is nothing particularly natural about Aveda shampoos anyway.
sentences.chinese: 所以在貼近自然方面，肯夢洗髮液其實並無特別之處。

definition: to pass through/to penetrate/by means of/via
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to stick close to/to press up against
the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
